Title: UPD 5
Comment: Paternal uniparental disomy of chromosome 5 is an uniparental disomy of paternal origin that most likely does not have any phenotypic expression except from cases of homozygosity for a recessive disease mutation for which only father is a carrier.

Title: Transient neonatal diabetes mellitus
Comment:
Caused by loss of maternal allele at 6q24
Caused by homo/Chet mutation in the ZFP57
a few cases have been reported to have duplications in the long arm of chromosome 6
Neonatal diabetes mellitus, insulin-requiring hyperglycemia within the first month

Title: Silver-Russell syndrome 2
Comment:
Short stature
prenatal and postnatal growth retardation
triangular shaped face
GeneReview: 7q32 (including MEST)

Title: Silver-Russell syndrome 1
Comment:
Maternal 11p15 duplication associated 
Short stature
prenatal and postnatal growth retardation
triangular shaped face

Title: Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome
Comment:
caused by mutation or deletion of imprinted genes within the chromosome 11p15.5 region(H19 and IGF2)
Wide phenotypic spectrum
Generalized overgrowth
Hemihypertrophy(특징적 증상이라고 함)
Macroglossia
Visceromegaly

Title: Temple syndrome
Comment:
Caused by imprinting defect on chromosome 14q32
Short stature
Hypotonia and motor delay
Feeding problem

Title: Kagami-Ogata syndrome
Comment:
Caused by chromosome 14 paternal uniparental disomy
Polyhydramnios(양수과다증)
Macrosomia
placentomegaly(태반비대)

Title: Prader-Willi syndrome
Comment:
Caused by deletion of the paternal allele of the imprinted region at 15q11.2
neonatal hypotonia
Failure to thrive
Obesity

Title: Angelman syndrome
Comment:
70%: deletion of maternal 15q12
3-5%: upd(15)pat
5%: mutation in UBE3A
Severe mental retardation with absent speech

Title: Pseudohypoparathyroidism Ib
Comment:
2~20%: upd(20)pat
GNAS point mutations
resistance to parathyroid hormone, 
hypocalcemia, 
Hyperphosphatemia
increased serum PTH

Title: Mulchandani-Bhoj-Conlin syndrome
Comment:
deletion of the paternal allele of the imprinted region at 20q11-q13
prenatal growth restriction
severe short stature with proportional head circumference
profound feeding difficulty
